[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: verify_multi_signatures()] [Empty Signature] At line 375-378, None signature returns EmptySignature error. But before that, check_voting_power at line 364 already validated quorum. Can an attacker pass voting power checks with an empty signature when using an all-zero BitVec? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: verify_multi_signatures()] [Public Key Aggregation] At line 380-381, PublicKey::aggregate can fail with FailedToAggregatePubKey. Can an attacker include public keys that cause aggregation failure (e.g., point at infinity) to DoS signature verification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: verify_multi_signatures()] [Verification Failure] At line 383-385, signature verification failure returns InvalidMultiSignature. Does this error hide the specific validator whose signature failed, making Byzantine validator identification impossible? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: verify_multi_signatures()] [CryptoHash Determinism] The message uses CryptoHash trait at line 346. If CryptoHash implementation is non-deterministic across validators, can different validators compute different hashes for the same message, causing verification failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: verify_multi_signatures()] [Author Tracking] At line 360, authors are collected but only used for voting power check. If the same author appears multiple times in BitVec (due to index collision), is their voting power counted multiple times? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: verify_aggregate_signatures()] [Message Count Mismatch] At line 391, messages is a slice of references. If messages.len() != number of set bits in aggregated_signature BitVec, does verify_aggregate properly reject, or can message/signature mismatch cause verification bypass? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: verify_aggregate_signatures()] [Message Ordering] At line 414-416, verify_aggregate is called with messages and pub_keys. If message order doesn't match BitVec order, can incorrect message-to-pubkey pairing cause valid signatures to be rejected or invalid ones accepted? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: verify_aggregate_signatures()] [Duplicate Messages] If messages slice contains duplicate message references, can an attacker aggregate multiple signatures for the same message under different public keys to manipulate voting power calculations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: verify_aggregate_signatures()] [Empty Messages] If messages slice is empty, does verify_aggregate accept any signature? Can this be exploited when combined with empty BitVec to bypass all verification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: verify_aggregate_signatures()] [Quorum Check Order] At line 407, check_voting_power is called before signature verification at line 414. Can an attacker pass quorum checks with valid voting power but invalid signatures, wasting resources on verification before signature checking? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: check_num_of_voters()] [Bucket Mismatch] At line 425-427, if bitvec.num_buckets() != required_buckets, InvalidBitVec is returned. Can an attacker craft a BitVec with correct bucket count but invalid internal structure to bypass this check? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: check_num_of_voters()] [Last Bit Overflow] At line 428-432, last_set_bit is checked against num_validators. If BitVec has bits set beyond num_validators but within bucket bounds, how is this rejected? Can bit positions >= num_validators but < bucket_capacity bypass checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: check_num_of_voters()] [No Set Bits] At line 428, if last_set_bit returns None (no bits set), the function returns Ok(()). Can an empty BitVec pass this check and reach voting power validation, bypassing signature requirements when quorum is misconfigured? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: check_num_of_voters()] [U16 Limitation] num_validators is u16 at line 422. If actual validator set exceeds 65535 validators, does truncation cause incorrect validation, allowing bits beyond the 16-bit limit to be accepted? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: check_num_of_voters()] [BitVec Mutation] This function takes &BitVec immutably, but BitVec might have interior mutability. Can concurrent modifications to BitVec during validation cause TOCTOU issues where checked bits change before use? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: sum_voting_power()] [Iterator Exhaustion] At line 441-447, the iterator is consumed to sum voting power. If the same iterator is used elsewhere after this call, can double-counting or missing validators occur? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: sum_voting_power()] [Overflow Accumulation] At line 444, voting_power is cast to u128 and accumulated. Even with u128, can repeated additions cause overflow if an attacker registers thousands of validators with u64::MAX voting power each? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: check_voting_power()] [Unknown Author Timing] At line 459, sum_voting_power can return UnknownAuthor early. Can timing side-channels reveal validator set composition by measuring how quickly UnknownAuthor is returned based on author position in iterator? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: check_aggregated_voting_power()] [Minority Check] At line 471, when check_super_majority is false, target = total - quorum + 1. Can this calculation underflow if quorum > total due to race conditions during validator set updates? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: check_aggregated_voting_power()] [Exact Quorum] At line 474, the check is aggregated_voting_power < target. Does this mean exactly meeting quorum is valid? Can off-by-one errors in quorum calculation allow minority voting power to achieve consensus? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: check_voting_power()] [Super Majority Bypass] At line 457, check_super_majority parameter controls quorum vs minority check. Can an attacker call this with check_super_majority=false to bypass quorum requirements and accept minority votes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: get_voting_power()] [Index Validity] At line 504-508, address_to_validator_index.get returns Option, then indexes validator_infos. Can index be stale if validator_infos is modified after index creation, causing out-of-bounds access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: sum_voting_power()] [Zero Voting Power] If validators have voting_power=0, they contribute nothing to sum. Can an attacker register many zero-power validators to inflate validator count without increasing total voting power, affecting quorum calculations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: filter_invalid_signatures()] [Parallel Verification Race] At line 296-297, parallel iterator with min_len(4) verifies signatures. Can race conditions cause verified signatures to be incorrectly added to pessimistic_verify_set if multiple threads process the same validator? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/validator_verifier.rs] [Function: filter_invalid_signatures()] [Pessimistic Set Pollution] At line 307, invalid validators are added to pessimistic_verify_set. Can an attacker intentionally send invalid signatures to pollute this set, forcing all future signatures from honest validators to be verified individually? (High)
